forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 46. Northwest wind 8 to 14 mph.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 54, with temperatures falling to around 52 in the afternoon. North northwest wind 5 to 14 mph.

weather_report:
As night envelops Downtown San Francisco, the sky remains mostly clear, a canvas adorned with a few twinkling stars. The crisp air, settling into the low forties, carries with it the distinct snap of winter, while a gentle northwest breeze stirs softly, urging one to wrap up warmly. Tomorrow promises a day bathed in sunshine, albeit with warmth holding back slightly until midday, when temperatures will stumble upon the lower fifties. The horizon reveals the remnants of a mild marine layer that often creeps over the bay, hinting at a morning shrouded in mist before surrendering to clearer skies.

In this tranquil evening, the city’s pulse ebbs gently, casting an invitation to linger in warm pleasures. This is an ideal setting for a stroll along the waterfront, where the shimmering lights of the bay tease the senses, or perhaps a visit to a cozy café, where rich aromas of coffee mingle with contemplation. As you venture out, consider layering clothing to balance the coolness of the night with the warmth of the interior, donning a light jacket paired with a scarf to ward off any lingering chill. Embrace the warmth of a hearty dinner, or indulge in the soft glow of a bookstore that promises escape and intrigue, all while the city cradles its quiet charm under the watchful stars.
